events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be worldâ€™s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. The cold is likely to continue this week as an Arctic air mass sinks south across Europe, pulling temperatures well below the seasonal average outside south-east Europe. Temperatures are expected to fall widely by about 5C (41F) below average, with some areas â€“ such as parts of central and north-eastern Europe â€“ up to 10C lower than the norm. events.description: Her comments came in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed call for the strategic, mineral-rich Arctic island to come under U.S. control in the aftermath of the weekend military operation in Venezuela.

events.title: A $400,000 profit on Maduro's capture raises insider trading questions on Polymarket
events.description: Online sleuths have tried to uncover who placed a winning bet on the Venezuelan leader's arrest to no avail. Still, prediction market watchers say the bet appears suspicious.

events.title: Uganda 2026 election: What you need to know
events.description: Voters in Uganda go to the polls on January 15 to elect a new president and members of parliament. DW breaks down the key facts you need to know ahead of the crucial vote.

events.title: Central African Republic: Touadera secures third term
events.description: President Faustin Archange Touadera has secured a third term, though the main opposition coalition boycotted the presidential election. Touadera is one of Russia's closest allies in Africa.

events.title: Germany: Alcohol prices well below EU average
events.description: Alcohol is cheaper in Germany than many other EU countries, with consumption still relatively high. However, there has been a fall in the amount that people, particularly young people and men, are drinking.

events.title: Venezuela's interim president: Who is Delcy Rodriguez?
events.description: Those who had hoped for Nobel Peace Prize laureate Maria Corina Machado to lead Venezuela were disappointed: The US and Donald Trump are going with former vice president Rodriguez.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.description: The German economy desperately needs a boost in 2026 after years of downturn. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: Questions raised over legality of US operation in Venezuela
events.description: In an address to House republicans ahead of the midterms, US President Donald Trump spoke of the 'amazing military achievement' in Venezuela following the US operation that led to the arrest of Nicola Maduro on January 3. But dissenting voices are raising questions about the legality of that operation, FRANCE 24's Andrew Hilliar says.

events.title: Replay: Watch Trump's address to House republicans and our analysis
events.description: Rewatch US President Donald Trump's address to House republicans ahead of pivotal midterms and listen to the analysis of FRANCE 24's correspondent to Washington, Fraser Jackson.

events.title: Last games of AFCON's round of 16 set to take place
events.description: As the AFCON4's round of 16 is set to end, Algeria and DR Congo are battling for a place in the quarterfinals in a highly-anticipated game on January 6. The Ivory Coast is also set to play Burkina Faso, with the former aiming to keep its title after winning the competition last year. FRANCE 24's Selina Sykes tells us more.

events.title: US envoys join in 'Coalition of the Willing' talks for first time
events.description: US President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner travelled to Paris for the meeting of the coalition, launched last year by France and Britain. They were welcomed at the Elysee Palace in Paris by French President Emmanuel Macron with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky for a one-on-one meeting before the summit FRANCE 24's Clovis Casalis tells us how significant their presence is, straight from Paris.

events.title: Follow live: Trump speaks about US intervention in Venezuela

events.title: UK bans junk food ads to fight childhood obesity
events.description: In an effort to combat childhood obesity, the United Kingdom has banned daytime TV and online ads that promote junk food. The health ministry says this could recede by 20,000 the number of children living with obesity. But some health advocates say the measures dont go far enough, as outside advertising and brands are still allowed as long as the unhealthy food is not shown.

events.title: Galette des rois: What is the French traditional king cake?
events.description: After all the sweet treats of the holidays, France has one more in store: la galette des rois or King Cake. Throughout the month of January, but especially on January 6 for Epiphany or Three Kings' Day, people head to the bakery to buy one. EugÃ©nie Pont from the magazine Fou de PÃ¢tisserie tells us everything you need to know about this delicious French tradition.
